messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] getting back to unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Me too. Your right. It s not about unschooling. BTW....when things fall in our home, which ever one is there yells I m okay!! Sadly, I m the awkward one. I
messages.messageBody:
Me too.
Your right. It's not about unschooling.

BTW....when things fall in our home, which ever one is there yells "I'm okay!!" Sadly, I'm the awkward one. I have more bruises than Brianna! I Loading the van, setting up tents, carrying, schlepping....yes, I get bruised..and then I'll shout "I'm alive!!"

Yes - the wonderful sounds of the absence of fear!
There's nothing like it!!

Brianna does get frightened. If she starts thinking of me dying. If she thinks she's dis-pleased me. We talk about it, still, she has these fears.
She still sleeps with me. Her bio-mom (and a few others) think that's terrible.
Maybe this comes from her bio-mom leaving her at the age of 26 months. Maybe it's from the abuse she suffered at her bio-moms hands. (Her Ernie doll was traded for a bag of heroin, her car seat - gone; etc)

Brianna has some fears. I'll not be adding to them.
Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: SandraDodd@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, April 11, 2003 2:10 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] getting back to unschooling



In a message dated 4/11/03 10:08:23 AM, jana@... writes:

<< What about the fact that the bible was censored/translated by men - under
the direction of King James - who definately had his own aganda? >>

It's not about unschooling.

Those who want to learn about the Bible are lucky to have GOOGLE.COM!


I love Google.

Sandra
